intro: Uragoga refracta, commonly known as the refracta plant, is a species native to specific regions in South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, slender stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Uragoga refracta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
